title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Disney's board replaced CEO Bob Chapek with Robert Iger, the former chairman and chief executive who left the company at the end of last year. Separately, Trian has purchased a sizable stake in the company and is seeking a seat on the board.

---

Failed cryptocurrency exchange FTX said in a filing that it owes its 50 largest creditors about $3.1 billion, with two creditors each owed more than $200 million.

---

Trade and investment between the U.S. and Europe are booming as Russia's war in Ukraine and fraying ties between the West and China draw the trans-Atlantic allies closer.

---

Sinking stock prices and a change in proxy-voting rules are emboldening many first-time shareholder activists to seek changes at some of the biggest U.S. corporations.

---

Small businesses grappling with inflation, labor shortages and strained supply chains are taking steps to blunt the impact of rising interest rates on their operations.

---

Carvana, a pandemic winner, is rushing to conserve cash as once-plentiful financing options dry up and the used-car dealer's business deteriorates.

---

Two of the largest U.S. railroad unions will reveal Monday whether their members voted to accept a new wage deal brokered by the White House, or reject it and move closer to a strike.
